de.hebis.it.hds.tools.streams

Class TextBlockSpliterator

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.hebis.it.hds.tools.streams.TextBlockSpliterator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Spliterator<java.util.List<java.lang.String>>

    public class TextBlockSpliterator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Spliterator<java.util.List<java.lang.String>>
    Simple Parser to find lines, they belongs together, representing an object. (e.g. XML tags)
    The detailed behavior is defined by a consumer, which is declared in the constructor.
    Author:
    Uwe 23.10.2014 2017-03-22 uh revised

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextBlockSpliterator

        public TextBlockSpliterator(java.util.Spliterator<java.lang.String> lines,
                            java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.String> startPattern,
                            java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.String> endPattern)
        Instance a new TextBlockSpliterator.
        ! This spliterator needs to have the markers, identifying a block in
        ! different strings and a marker may not distributed over two strings.
        Parameters:
        lines - A sequentiell stream of strings (eg. lines of a file)
        startPattern - Pattern to identify the first line of a block
        endPattern - Pattern to identify the last line of a block

      • toTextBlocks

        public static java.util.stream.Stream<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> toTextBlocks(java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String> lines,

                                                                                     java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.String> blockEndPattern,
                                                                                     boolean parallel)
        Factory for a new TextBlockSpliterator
        Parameters:
        lines - The Stream to consume
        blockStartPattern - Pattern to identify the start of a block
        blockEndPattern - Pattern to identify the end of a block
        parallel - May the output stream processed in parallel or not
        Returns:
        A stream of blocks (block ~ list of strings)
